intro: Pecteilis hawkesiana, commonly known as the Hawkes' pecteilis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Pecteilis hawkesiana is typically found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands.
